Six out of the 18 Arabidopsis accessions (An-1, Bay-0, Cad-0, Cum-0, Ll-0, and Fei-0) and 2 virus isolates (Fny-CMV and JPN1-TuMV) were selected to analyze the relationship between 9 traits proposed to be linked to virus seed transmission and ST and IS. Specifically, we calculated the effects of virus infection on rosette weight ( RW) (ratio of RW of infected plants/ RW of mock-inoculated plants [ RW i / RW m ]), inflorescence weight ( IW) ( IW i / IW m ), and short-term (seed germination percentage at time zero [ G 0]) ( G 0
